description: From Latin emaculatus, past participle of emaculare (“to clear from spots”). See maculate.

verbs.description: emaculate (third-person singular simple present emaculates, present participle emaculating, simple past and past participle emaculated)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To clear from spots or stains, or from any imperfection.
examples: taken great pains with him in emaculating the Text, in ſetling the reading […]
